p:
Traditionally, the quantitative kinetics of enzyme-catalyzed reactions have been studied in terms of the correlation between initial rates and substrate concentrations according to the hyperbolic Michaelis–Menten equation. Although direct analysis that use Michaelis–Menten equation is easy to perform by various nonlinear regression curve-fitting programmes, the initial-velocity measurements still require a high number of individual experiments, due to the high sensitivity of the reaction rates to noise
18 . On the other hand, analyses of complete progress curves can provide the same information, although this can be achieved with a single experimental assay that measures the kinetics data at every concentration between the initial value and that at the end of the reaction.
